strings.string: You've transgressed the sacred vow. Now you will pay the ultimate price.
Create a Bronze God of War
Bring "Big Magic" to your clan by building 1 stone circle!
Have in your possession 50 bronze spears, knives, and axes!
Have more cattle than humans, while having a human population greater than 150.
Sacrifice 50 perpetrators to the Blood God.
Sacrifice 250 perpetrators to the Blood God.
Sacrifice 500 perpetrators to the Blood God.
Sacrifice 1,000 perpetrators to the Blood God.
The first human amongst you has fallen. Expect many more deaths.
Survive 3 terrible invasions. (Need to beef up the story here a bit...)
Your villagers have discovered a new way to extract flint from the earth. Triggered by collecting 50 flints!
The Gods of War Smile Upon Your Bravery
The Gods of the Underworld are Pleased with the Depth of your Devotion (2 Mines have been built)
20 logs have been added to your stockpile
30 logs have been added to your stockpile
40 stone have been added to your stockpile
The hills echo with battle cries.

You don't have much time before a small scouting team comes upon your encampment. Build some weapons right away! Tip: Build wooden spears and harpoons, they're quick to build and you have enough sticks.
The children have been hearing strange sounds from the forest.

Dead raiders surround your settlement. Your war chief bends down for a closer look at their war paint. His face twists into one of horror. "That was just a scouting party", he exclaims with horror. "Sound the war horn!"

A commotion in the village! One of the village elders falls to his knees in desperate prayer. The crowd parts, and forms an open circle around Timmy (an adorable child). A large "X" is painted on his forehead in wolf-blood. "I've seen enough!" growls your war chief before storming out. "Does this mean... Are they coming?" someone asks. "No," replies the elder solemnly. "They're already here."
Survive this invasion and achieve a milestone!
This one is gonna be a beast.

You've unlocked the power to harness the earth. Be careful while building fortifications. Such an outright display of strength is sure to anger your enemies... Tip: Build walls and a gate, but don't build towers until you're ready to defend against the tide of invaders who'll storm your fortress driven by jealosy, bloodlust, and sacrificial zeal. Also: Also, defensive platforms won't trigger anu invasions. (Atleast for now.)

Rumor has it that your settlement has unlocked a strange new technology which can "shoot arrows from the sky." The rival clan of Uhrghor is paying close attention. Tip: Wait until your population is greater than 65 before building any towers. Defensive platforms are okay though.

How dare you mock the strength of the Uhrghors! An elite warrior band marches to your settlement to prove man is mightier than fixtures of wood and dirt. They yearn to prove their strength with the bloody edge of a battle axe.
Your victory against the Uhrghors has spread near and far! Expect increased migration to your settlement!
Your Towers Taunt your Enemies' Gods

Be wary, for your display of outright strength has taunted the all-powerful Gahrghor Clan. They gather in the far plains of the East, bidding their time. In the meantime, no one wants to join your settlement out of sheer terror. Don't expect any migration until the Gahrghors are dealt with. Tip: If you build 12 towers, the Gahrghors will invade in massive numbers. (Have a population > 125)

For 50 migrations of the buffalo, the Gahrghor Clan has ruled in the far off plains of the East. But lately, clouds the size of mountains can be seen coming from the East. It's the Gahrghors! They're on the move. It must of been your arrogant towers which has beckoned their wrath. And now, you must pay.

Your battlement's walls are decorated with the slain bodies of your enemies. Most impressive of all, Chieftan Ourga's head sits upon a spike at your fortress' entrance. Truly, you have shown your strength. Expect increased migrations while all the neighboring settlements hear of your astonishing victory.
Your village is getting stronger. A rival clan has taken notice. (This was triggered because your prestige is greater than 210.)
A sudden wind blows from the east, bringing early cold temperatures. Winter is upon us.
A sudden wind blows from the east, bringing early cold temperatures. Winter is upon us.
A village elder died while performing a sacrifice to the fire god. Summer has arrived early.

You survived for 6 long years. Congratulations!
(A note from the creator: That's all the gameplay I designed for now. Let me know if you enjoyed this mod + how it can be improved. Cheers!)
